physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Variations in blood pressure were interpreted as resulting from loss of baroreceptor reflex mediated mechanisms.
Physical examination revealed an enlarged lymph node in the left groin.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Indicated significant worsening with histological examination confirming metastasis of the paraganglioma.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: CT scan revealed irregular destruction of the petrosal bone and the temporomandibular joint.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: In 2005, again found to have hypertension, elevated excretion of norepinephrine (0.51 /H9262mol/24 h) and borderline increase in VMA (30 /H9262mol/24 h). Postoperatively, 24-h urinary catecholamine secretion was normal.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Patient had persistent hypertension despite treatment.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Postoperative urinary samples showed reduction in catecholamine secretion, but no normalization.
